listing.title: General Volunteer Opportunities
listing.description: Volunteer opportunities include delivering meals to the homebound, visiting isolated older adults, performing clerical tasks, transporting clients on an as needed basis, assisting at the Shabbat Luncheon, providing legal counseling services, guiding visitors through agency facilities and informing them about agency programs, assisting with group activities at the group living facilities, adult day care center, or nursing home, responding to the needs of crime victims, working at the gift shop, participating in intergenerational programs, assisting with special projects, and others. For more information, email CJE or contact Anne Schuman, Director of Volunteer Services.

listing.title: Reclamation
listing.description: A volunteer is needed on Fridays in the morning at the Bloomfield facility to inspect and evaluate damaged cans and packages of nonperishable food products and sort and redistribute the donations to the warehouse shopping area.
listing.skill: A 2-hour training session is required, and volunteers must make a weekly commitment for a minimum of 6 months.

listing.title: Reproductive Health Services of Planned Parenthood
listing.description: Three volunteer positions are available at RHS: 1) Options counseling for women with troubled pregnancies 2) Providing information and answering questions for women calling about RHS services 3) Giving emotional support and comfort to patients in the clinic. In depth professional training is provided for all positions, and RHS is looking for volunteers who are willing to make a minimum commitment of one four-hour shift per week for a year. Daytime, evening, and Saturday shifts are available.

parent.name: National Council of Jewish Women St. Louis Section

listing.title: Kitchen - Preparing Meals
listing.description: Volunteers help prepare meals with a team of chefs. You might peel and chop vegetables, assist in pre-bake preparation, or package the daily meals.
